chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Meinen Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $4,764.42 and restitution surcharges.  NOTE:  $500.00 has been applied toward restitution leaving a balance due of $4,264.42.
-------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT 
-------------------

No contact with the victim without victim's and Agent's consent. Not to possess or consume medication without a valid prescription. No possession or consumption of alcohol. No possession or consumption of illegal drugs. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
-------------------

Comply with any counseling as recommended by the probation agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------
Complete an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommended counseling.

timeConds.notes: The Defendant is to serve thirty (30) days in the Walworth County Jail with NO work release privileges to commence on or before September 27, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m.

9:23 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas L Meinen Jr. in court.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Thomas L Meinen Jr. 
Atty Frost would like to enter a change of plea and withhold sentencing for another date. 
No objections. 
No victim present. 
Deft will enter guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CF124- withheld 3 years probation. 
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Deft enters guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CF124. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Court gives warning to deportation. 
Sentencing hearing set for September 13, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560.

BOND TO COVER 22GF209 & 22CT58
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH F.D.G. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-984 thru 22-986
